original:
The Bible of Federico da Montefeltro, also known as the Bibbia Urbinate, is an illuminated manuscript that contains the Vulgate text. Commissioned by Federico III da Montefeltro, the Duke of Urbino, the manuscript was produced in Florence between 1476 and 1478. It is currently housed in the Vatican Apostolic Library (Urb.Lat.1 and 2).


The Bible was commissioned by Federico III da Montefeltro, a prominent condottiero and Duke of Urbino
